name: Kirbinator
description:
This algorithm continuously records audio into a buffer and plays slices of the buffer under the influence of various probabilities. The slices can be pitched up and down, played forwards and backwards, and panned in stereo.

Key to its operation are two trigger inputs: the Mark input defines slice boundaries in the audio buffer based on rhythmic clock signals (e.g., quarter notes or eighth notes), while the Trigger input determines when new slices are selected for playback and when parameters like pitch, direction, and panning may change. Playback continues with updated parameters until another Trigger is received.

The stereo audio buffer can be routed as mono, stereo, or mono-in/stereo-out via adjustable routing settings. By default, behavior is stochastic (random), but repeatable patterns are achievable through the 'Random seed' parameter and gradual mutations between probability sets using the 'Mutate' parameter. Transient detection allows automatic slice marking when enabled.

Unclocked operations enable creative use with irregular triggers (e.g., footswitches) for start/stop control, while the 'Feedback' parameter can simulate delay or echo effectsâ€”especially pronounced in reverse playback.
use_cases: Rhythmic slice-based processing with clocked Mark/Trigger inputs
Unclocked granular effects using footswitches or manual triggers
Transient-triggered slice playback without explicit clocking
Glide and pitch modulation for tape-stop-like artifacts
gui_description: The display shows a waveform of the audio buffer. A short, dark line indicates current recording position, while longer lines represent active playback slices. Checkmarks along the top denote slice boundaries (Marks). Visual feedback reflects real-time processing states.

input_ports.name: Audio Input (Left/mono)
input_ports.description: Stereo or mono audio signal input for recording into the buffer. Routing determined by 'Left/mono input' parameter.

input_ports.name: Audio Input (Right)
input_ports.description: Right channel of stereo audio input, if applicable. Routing controlled via 'Right input' parameter.

input_ports.name: Mark Input
input_ports.description: Trigger signal defining slice boundaries in the buffer. Bus selected by 'Mark input' parameter.

input_ports.name: Trigger Input
input_ports.description: Trigger signal initiating new slice playback and applying random parameters. Bus selected by 'Trigger input' parameter.

input_ports.name: Stop Input
input_ports.description: Trigger signal halting current playback. Bus selected by 'Stop input' parameter.

input_ports.name: Pitch Offset CV Input
input_ports.description: 1V/octave pitch control voltage added to the probabilistic pitch offset. Bus selected by 'Pitch offset input' parameter.

output_ports.name: Audio Output (Left/mono)
output_ports.description: Left or mono channel of processed audio output, routed via 'Left/mono output' parameter.

output_ports.name: Audio Output (Right)
output_ports.description: Right channel of stereo processed audio output, if applicable. Routing controlled by 'Right output' parameter.
